lead_paragraph: The Rent Guidelines Board voted 5 to 4 to consider a 0 percent to 2 percent rent increase on one-year leases, and a 0.5 percent to 3.5 percent increase on two-year leases.

headline.print_headline: Rent Board Could Freeze Stabilized Leases Again
headline.main: New York City Board Could Freeze One-Year Stabilized Leases for Another Year

snippet: The Rent Guidelines Board voted 5 to 4 to consider a 0 percent to 2 percent rent increase on one-year leases, and a 0.5 percent to 3.5 percent increase on two-year leases.
abstract: New York City's Rent Guidelines Board votes 5 to 4 to consider a 0 percent to 2 percent increase on one-year leases and 0.5 percent to 3.5 percent on two-year leases when rate increases on city's rent-controlled properties are finalized in June; ranges open possibility of board's second-ever rent freeze on one-year properties following freeze enacted in 2015.
